DOCUMENT I S THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'b GOVHRi-TiiENT) R E T . lfft)(39U2Q. COPY NO. / O WAR CFJIHET. DOMINION AIR TRAlFTFG 3CFEME. ( P r e v i o u s Paper No. W . P . ( G ) ( 5 9 ) 1 0 5 ). N o t e "by t h e S e c r e t a r y, The f o l l o w i n g a r e c i r c u l a t e d f o r r e c o r d , v / i th r e f e r e n c e to t h e d i s c u s s i o n s i n War C a b i n e t y e s t e r d a y and t o - d a y on q u e s t i o n s o u t s t a n d i n g i n c o n n e c t i o n w i t h the Dominion Air T r a i n i n g Scheme (W.M.(39) 9 6 t h C o n c l u s i o n s, M i n u t e 6, and W.M..'(39.) 9 7 t h C o n c l u s i o n s , Minute 5 ) : - T e l e g r a m No. 710, d a t e d t h e 2 5 t h November, f r om t h e High C o m m i s s i o n e r i n Canada. T e l e g r am No. 56S, d a t e d t h e 2 6 t h November, t o t h e High C o m m i s s i o n e r i n Canada. T e l e g r am No. 7 1 3 , d a t e d t h e 2 6 t h November, f r om t h e High C o m m i s s i o n e r i n Canada. I&raft as s u b m i t t e d t o t h e War C a b i n e t of t e l e g r a m f r om t h e Prime M i n i s t e r to Mr. M a c k e n z i e King. T e l e g r am No. I l l , d a t e d t h e 2 7 t h November, f r om t h e Prime M i n i s t e r t o Mr. Mackenzie King ( a s f i n a l l y a p p r o v e d and d e s p a t c h e d ). T e l e g r a m s Nos. 716, 717 and 7 1 8 , d a t e d t he 2 7 t h November, from t h e High C o m m i s s i o n e r in C a n a d a . T e l e g r a m No. 118, d a t e d t h e 2 7 t h November, f r om Mr. Mackenzie K i n g. ( S i g n e d ) E.E. BRIDGES. S e c r e t a r y . I Richmond T e r r a c e , S.W.I. 2 8 t h November, 1939.
CYPHER TELEGRAM CANADA. Prom the United Kingdom High Commissioner in Canada. Dated 25th November, Received 3.30 p.m. 25th November, 1939. Mo s t Imme di at e. No. 710 Secret,. Prime Minister whom I saw this morning, absolutely refuses to allow his Ministers to initial any agreement on air training scheme until he has received from United Kingdom Government satisfactory assurances on points (a) and (b) in paragraph 11 of my telegram No, 650. He takes view that these stipulations are reasonable and could easily be given by United Kingdom Government. Unless, however, it is possible for me to receive notice by Monday morning at latest that His Majesty's Government are prepared to agree forthwith to stipulations as they stand in my telegram 650 I fear all hopes of initialling memorandum of agreement must be abandoned with consequences (as both Pairbairn and New Zealanders are leaving) of which you are already aware. I have discussed this with Riverdale and Balfour and while we fully realise difficulties which His Majesty's Government must naturally find in agreeing (as explained in your earlier telegrams) we feel bound to urge most strongly that they should accept these points as they stand in order to avoid a complete breakdown.
CifPiLaE TELEGRAM CANADA To the United Kingdom High Goiranissioner in Canada. Sent at 3. ;-r,0 p.m. on 26th November, 1039. MOST I MEDIATE . No. 556 SECRET. 1. Your telegram No. 710 -if 25th November. Matter will have to go to war Cabinet tomorrow morning for most urgent consideration with a view to immediate message being sent from Prime Minister to Mr. Mackenzie King. 2. Meanwhile, we want to be wuite clear as to what will enable Canadian Prime Minister to allow his Ministers to initial Agreement. You speak of "satisfactory assurances" on points (a) and (b) in paragraph 11 of your telegram No. 650. Later, you speak of your receiving notice that "His Majesty's Government are prepared to agree forthwith to stipulations as they stand." 5. Will lie be satisfied with assurance that we understand completely that the Agreement when initialled would not bind Canadian Government (any more than United Kingdom Government) unless and until (a) and (b) are disposed of to his satisfaction as soon as may be thereafter. 4. Or is the position that Canada will not initial the Agreement until we have as regards (a) actually given the assurance he desires, and as regards (b) given an assurance that the financial discussions will reach a mutually satisfying result. The former presents difficulties enough. The latter is clearly impossible seeing that in fact the discussions' cannot even start effectively until Towers arrives.
5 . If answer t o (-3) i s a f f i r m a t i v e and you c a r e to l et us have y o u r p e r s o n a l s u g g e s t i o n s as to w o r d i n g w h i c h would meet t h e c a s e , t h e s e c o u l d f o l l o w u r g e n t l y. 6 . If answer t o (4) i s a f f i r m a t i v e , can we c o n c e i ve of an a r r a n g e m e n t u n d e r which U n i t e d Kingdom, A u s t r a l i a and Rew Z e a l a n d o n l y would i n i t i a l Agreement w i t h an u n d e r s t a n d i ng "between them t h a t i t would come i n t o e f f e c t , w i t h o r w i t h o ut s u c h m o d i f i c a t i o n s as m i g h t h e s u b s e q u e n t l y a g r e e d , as scon as t h e two o u t s t a n d i n g p o i n t s b e t w e e n U n i t e d Kingdom and Canada h a d b e e n c l e a r e d u p . This p r o c e d u r e would seem t o r e q u i r e a c o l l a t e r a l u n d e r s t a n d i n g w i t h C a n a d i a n Government which need n o t however t a k e t h e form of a commitment a t t h i s s t a g e. 7 . P l e a s e r e p l y a t v e r y e a r l i e s t p o s s i b l e moment, if p o s s i b l e by 6 . 0 p.m. London t i m e t h i s e v e n i n g,
CYPPKI: TELEGRAM C/iNADA Prom the United Kingdom High Commissioner in Canada. Dated 26th November, 1 9 3 9 . Received 9 . 4 4 p.m. 25th November, 1 9 3 9 . LI03T IMMEDIATE. No. 713 Secret. 1 Your telegram No. 566. we are satisfied that any undertaking of nature suggested at paragraph 3 Of your telegram would entirely fail to meet critical situation. Prime Minister's whole case is that the Canadian Government's views as to preference of effort are primarily for themselves to decide and should be accepted by His Majesty's Government in the United Kingdom in that spirit. As regards over-all financial questions, he feels strongly that too much has been asked of Canada and that matters have already been allowed t o drag on far t o o long. He feels it quite unnecessary at this stage to delay matter for visit of Towers and feels that Canadians could well have been given satisfactory treatment, if not earlier, at any rate in discussion with Crerar whose telegrams on the subject, we gather, have been far from reassuring. 2. Prime Minister is in a frank and quite uncompromising mood and states that his Cabinet are united behind him. life therefore see no hope whatever of shaking him. 3. We may add that the points (a) and (b) in paragraph 11 of my telegram No. 650 were drafted at the time in collaboration with the officials delegated by the Prime Minister for that very purpose, and were purposely drafted in more moderate terms
terras than Canadians had originally proposed. 4. We therefore repeat that the Prime Minister requires to receive, before initialling, (l) an assurance regarding preference of effort in terms of (a) i n paragraph 11 of my telegram No. 650, and ( 2 ) a written statement that any agreement thus initialled is subject zo condition mentioned at (b) in paragraph 11 of the same telegram. 5. V/e feel that the suggestion in paragraph 6 of your telegram No. 566 would have the effect of confirming public opinion here, which is already suspicious in its belief that a rift exists between the delegations. 6. we must therefore press once more for full assurances by the United Kingdom Government as indicated in paragraph 4 of the present telegram at the earliest possible moment. we are fully agreed that these should, i f possible, be given in direct personal message from the United Kingdom Prime Minister. This to achive its object should reach Ottawa at the latest by 10 a . B i . Canadian time, tommow Monday, Ends.
D r a f t T e l e g r a m , t o t h e C a n a d i a n Government. No. Secret host I m m e d i a t e. F o l l o w i n g f r om P r i m e M i n i s t e r t o P r i m e M i n i s t er b e g i n s . As I u n d e r s t a n d t h e f u l l r e p o r t s which h a v e r e a c h ed me f r om t h e Air M i s s i o n now a t Ottawa v/e a r e now w i t h in s i g h t of a g r e e m e n t on t h e A i r T r a i n i n g Scheme w h i c h , w i th m o d i f i c a t i o n s now b e i n g made t o meet t h e p o i n t s most r e c e n t l y r a i s e d by A u s t r a l i a n arid New Z e a l a n d d e l e a t i o n s, r e t a i n s i t s c o - o p e r a t i v e c h a r a c t e r as a scheme of t h e most f a r r e a c h i n g i m p o r t a n c e . We a r e g r a t e f u l f o r a l l t h a t you and your M i n i s t e r s have done t o e n s u r e the s u c c e s s of t h e se n e g o t i a t i o n s and we a l s o a p p r e c i a t e g r e a t l y t h e c o o p e r a t i o n e x t e n d e d t o Mr. Osborne i n t h e f i n a n c i al d i s c u s s i o n s which h a v e p r o c e e d e d a t t h e same time on t he w i d e r a s p e c t s of our w a r - t i m e economic r e l a t i o n s . These we h o p e t o b r i n g t o a m u t u a l l y s a t i s f a c t o r y c o n c l u s i on a s s o o n as p o s s i b l e a f t e r Mr. Graham Towers has j o i n ed Mr. C r e r a r h e r e . I f u l l y u n d e r s t a n d t h a t t h e c o n t r i b u t i on f r om Canada w h i c h t h e d r a f t scheme c o n t e m p l a t e s i s s u b j e ct t o t h e s e f i n a n c i a l o h l s c u s s i o n s l e a d i n g to a m u t u a l l y and r e a s o n a b l y s a t i s f y i n g a g r e e m e n t and, g i v e n t h e g o o d w i ll w h i c h e x i s t s on b o t h s i d e s , t h e r e i s no r e a s o n t o s u p p o se t h a t s u c h a g r e e m e n t w i l l not be r e a c h e d. 2 . There i s t h e f u r t h e r s t i p u l a t i o n which, as I u n d e r s t a n d i t , you r e g a r d as e s s e n t i a l , namely t h a t your Government s h o u l d r e c e i v e an a s s i i r a n c e , which t h e y w o u l d be a t l i b e r t y t o announce i f t h e y so w i s h , t h a t i n the o p i n i o n of our War C a b i n e t h e r e t h e Air T r a i n i n g Scheme h a s p r e f e r e n c e over any o t h e r commitment i n C a n a d a ' s war e f f o r t s , o t h e r t h a n t h o s e a l r e a d y e n t e r e d i n t o.
3. You w o u l d , I am s u r e , "be t h e f i r s t to r e c o g n i se t h a t c o n s t i t u t i o n a l c o n s i d e r a t i o n s would i n normal c i r c u m s t a n c e s make i t i n a p p r o p r i a t e f o r one of His M a j e s t y ' s Governments t o e x p r e s s an o p i n i o n as t o t he c o m p a r a t i v e i m p o r t a n c e of one as a g a i n s t a n o t h e r i t em i n t h e p o l i c y of a n o t h e r of His M a j e s t y ' s G o v e r n m e n t s. The p o s i t i o n i s p e r h a p s m o d i f i e d by t h e f a c t t h a t you h a v e d e f i n i t e l y asked f o r s u c h an e x p r e s s i o n of o p i n i o n. 4 . I s h o u l d e x p l a i n t h a t we o u r s e l v e s have a t t a c h ed t h e h i g h e s t p r i o r i t y t o t h i s T r a i n i n g Scheme, as i n d e ed t o our a i r e f f o r t as a w h o l e , which we b e l i e v e may h e a d e c i s i v e f a c t o r in t h e w a r . If t h e C a n a d i a n Government d e c i d e t o c o n t r i b u t e t o t h e Seheme on t h e s c a le c o n t e m p l a t e d , t h e i r p o l i c y w i l l be i n t h e c l o s e st c o r r e s p o n d e n c e w i t h our own. 5. On t h e o t h e r h a n d , any p u b l i c a n n o u n c e m e nt a t t h is s t a g e i n t h e t e r m s you s u g g e s t , would, i n o u r o p i n i o ns b e open t o two g r a v e o b j e c t i o n s i n t h a t f i r s t i t would c o n v e y t o t h e enemy a most i m p o r t a n t i n d i c a t i o n as to t h e r e l a t i v e p r i o r i t i e s of our war e f f o r t . s e c o n d l y, s u c h an announcement might have e m b a r r a s s i n g e f f e c t s on o u r r e l a t i o n s w i t h t h e F r e n c h who a r e p r e s s i n g us s t r o n g l y t o i n c r e a s e our e f f o r t on l a n d. 6- I am s u r e t h a t you w i l l a g r e e t h a t t h e s e are v e ry s t r o n g r e a s o n s a g a i n s t an announcement i n r e g a r d to which o n o t h e r g r o u n d s we s h o u l d have b e e n g l a d t o meet your v i e w s . We a r e however e n t i r e l y w i l l i n g t h a t i t s h o u ld toe u n d e r s t o o d b e t w e e n us t h a t n o t h i n g i n C a n a d a ' s war e f f o r t can b e r e g a r o l e d as e x c e e d i n g i n i m p o r t a n c e h er c o n t r i b u t i o n t o t h e Air T r a i n i n g Scheme. - 2 I hope t h a t what I have s a i d w i l l remove any m i s a p p r e h e n s i o n s which may e x i s t as t o t h e e x t e n t to w h i c h Canada would he c o m m i t t e d b y t h e i n i t i a l l i n g of t h e A i r T r a i n i n g Agreement b e f o r e t h e A u s t r a l i a n and New Z e a l a n d d e l e g a t e s l e a v e . O t t a w a . If, however, you t h i n k t h a t t h e m a t t e r r e q u i r e s s t i l l f u r t h er c l a r i f i c a t i o n I s u g g e s t , s i n c e time w i l l n o t p e r m it o f a f u l l e r exchange of v i e w s , t h a t t h e a g r e e m e n t might b e i n i t i a l l e d by t h e r e p r e s e n t a t i v e s of t h e U n i t ed Kingdom, A u s t r a l i a and New Z e a l a n d w i t h an u n d e r s t a n d i ng b e t w e e n them t h a t t h e Agreement would come i n t o e f f e c t, w i t h or w i t h o u t such m o d i f i c a t i o n s as m i g h t be s u b s e q u e n t l y a g r e e d , as s o o n as t h e two o u t s t a n d i ng p o i n t s b e t w e e n t h e U n i t e d Kingdom and Canada h a d b e en c l e a r e d u p. I am s u r e you w i l l a g r e e t h a t i t would be d e p l o r a b l e i f no s o r t of a g r e e m e n t or u n d e r s t a n d i ng h a d b e e n r e a c h e d b e f o r e A u s t r a l i a n and New Z e a l a nd d e l e g a t e s l e f t Canada, even t h o u g h t h e d e t a i l s c o u ld n o t be p u b l i c l y d i s c l o s e d f o r t h e time b e i n g . Ends.
CYPHER TELEGRAM. CANADA. To the Government of Canada. S e n t 2,40 p.m. , 2 7 t h November-, 1959. MOST;IMMEDIATE. No. I l l S e c r e t. F o l l o w i n g f r om P r i m e M i n i s t e r tc P r i m e M i n i s t e r h e g i n s. As I u n d e r s t a n d t h e f u l l r e p o r t s which nave r e a c h e d me from t h e A i r M i s s i o n now a t Ottawa we a r e w i t h i n s i g h t of a g r e e ment on t h e A i r T r a i n i n g Scheme w h i c h , w i t h m o d i f i c a t i o n s now b e i n g made t o meet t h e p o i n t s most r e c e n t l y r a i s e d by A u s t r a l i an and New Z e a l a n d d e l e g a t i o n s , r e t a i n s i t s c o - o p e r a t i v e c h a r a c t er a s a scheme of t h e most f a r r e a c h i n g i m p o r t a n c e . We a r e g r a t e f ul f o r a l l t h a t ycu and y o u r M i n i s t e r s have dene t o e n s u r e the s u c c e ss cf t h e s e n e g o t i a t i o n s and we a l s o a p p r e c i a t e g r e a t l y t h e c o o p e r a t i o n e x t e n d e d t o Mr. Osborne i n t h e f i n a n c i a l d i s c u s s i o ns which have p r o c e e d e d a t the same t i m e on the w i d e r a s p e c t s of cur w a r - t i m e economic r e l a t i o n s . These vx'e hope t c b r i n g to a m u t u a l ly s a t i s f a c t o r y c o n c l u s i o n as soon as p o s s i b l e a f t e r Mr. Graham Towers has j o i n e d Mr. C r e r a r h e r e. 2. I f u l l y u n d e r s t a n d t h a t t h e c o n t r i b u t i o n f r om Canada which t h e d r a f t scheme c o n t e m p l a t e s has b e e n p r o p o s e d s u b j e c t to t h e se f i n a n c i a l d i s c u s s i o n s l e a d i n g to a m u t u a l l y and r e a s o n a b ly s a t i s f y i n g a g r e e m e n t a n d g i v e n the g o o d w i l l which e x i s t s on b o th s i d e s t h e r e i s no r e a s o n t o s u p p o s e t h a t such an a g r e e m e n t w i ll n e t be r e a c h e d. 3* I u n d e r s t a n d t h a t b e f o r e i n i t i a l l i n g the Agreement you w i sh to have an a s s u r a n c e from us t h a t t h e C a n a d i a n G o v e r n m e n t ! g views as t o p r e f e r e n c e of e f f o r t a r e p r i m a r i l y f o r t h e m s e l v e s to d e c i d e and t h a t we w^uld a c c e p t t h e i r d e c i s i o n i n t h a t s p i r i t.
I have no hesitation in giving this assurance as I entirely agree that it is Tor Canada to decide on the priority of her effort and therefore I should not think of interfering in it whatever our own opinions might be. 4. I should explain that we ourselves have attached the highest priority to this Training Scheme, as indeed to our air effort as a whole, which we believe may be a decisive factor in the war. If the Canadian Government decided to contribute to the Scheme on the scale contemplated, their polios'- will be in the closest correspondence with our own. But we should not have liked to emphasise the priority of the Air Training Scheme lest it should have embarrassing effects on DUT relations with' the French who ere pressing us strongly to increaee our effort on land. 5. I hope that what I have said will remove any misapprehensions which may exist as to the extent to w hi oh Canada would be committed by the initialling of the Air Training Agreement before the Australian and New Zealand delegates leave Ottawa. In the circumstances I should like to appeal to you to agree to initial the agreement with us so that we may now take this essential step forward in our joint war effort.
CYPHER TELEGRAM CANADA Prom the United Kingdom High Commissioner in Canada. Dated 27th November 1939. Received 3.40 a.in. on 28th Nov. 1939. MOLT IMMEDIATE. NO. 715. (l) As a r-esult of a series of meetings today with other Canadian Ministers and with myself;, the position now is that the Prime Minister is satisfied, with the wording of the message from the Prime Mini, ter of the United Kingdom to the Canadian Government No. Ill on the financial issue (point (b) of paragraph 11 of my 0650), Prime Minister is still dissatisfied, with the situation regarding the preference of effort. (2) He also objected to being rushed, by decisions of other Empire Delegations and said that he and his colleagues must have time to consider the whole agreement with deliberation which its importance required. (3) As it was therefore impossible to initial the agreement between all four parties before Pairbairn left this evening I insisted that some step to prevent open appearance in the Press of comment that Pairbairn's departure without any result meant that the Imperial nature of the scheme had to be dropped. Prime Minister therefore proposed, and other delegates including the Australians and New Zealanders as a last resort -accepted a Press release terms of which the Prime Minister drafted, himself and which he is telegraphing direct to Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. (4) Please see also my immediately following telegram.
CYPHER TELEGRAM CANADA From t h e U n i t e d Kingdom High C o m m i s s i o n e r i n Canada. Dated 2 7 t h November, 1939 R e c e i v e d 3 . 4 8 a.m. 2 3 t h N o v e m b e r , 1 9 3 9. MOST IMMEDIATE No. 717 S e c r e t. ( l ) ^.s i n d i c a t e d i n my i m m e d i a t e l y p r e c e d i n g t e l e g r am t h e Prime M i n i s t e r i s s t i l l n o t s a t i s f i e d w i t h a s s u r a n c es g i v e n i n p a r a g r a p h 3 of your t e l e g r a m No. I l l t o t he C a n a d i a n Government r e g a r d i n g t h e p r e f e r e n c e of e f f o r t. I t i s n o t t o - d a y , e v e n t h o u g h i t was on S a t u r d a y , i n h is v i ew - s u f f i c i e n t for i t t o be r e c o g n i s e d e v e n p u b l i c l y t h at Canada n a t u r a l l y h a s a r i g h t t o h e r own v i e w s on the s u b j e c t . He r e q u i r e s t h a t he s h o u l d have a c l e a r s t a t e m e nt f r om the U n i t e d Kingdom Government ( w h i c h he c a n make p u b l i c v/hen he w i s h e s ) t h a t t h e y t h e m s e l v e s a g r e e t h a t Canada i s r i g h t i n r e g a r d i n g t h e A i r T r a i n i n g Scheme a s h e r main war e f f o r t. ( 2 ) The p r i m e M i n i s t e r w i l l i n s h o r t n o t be s a t i s f i ed u n l e s s t h e U n i t e d Kingdom Government communicate w i t h him i n t e r m s , w h i c h he i s at l i b e r t y to u s e p u b l i c l y , of p a r a g r a p h 4 of y o u r t e l e g r a m No. I l l t o C a n a d i a n Government w i t h t h e i n s e r t i o n of t h e f o l l o w i n g s e n t e n c e a f t e r "in c l o s e s t c o - o p e r a t i o n w i t h our own". b e g i n s . C o n s i d e r i ng t h e p r e s e n t and f u t u r e r e q u i r e m e n t s we f e e l t h at p a r t i c i p a t i o n i n t h e A i r T r a i n i n g Scheme would p r o v i de more e f f e c t i v e a s s i s t a n c e t h a n any o t h e r form of c o - o p e r a t i o n w h i c h Canada c o u l d g i v e . Ends. ( 3 ) As i n d i c a t e d i n my i m m e d i a t e l y p r e c e d i n g t e l e g r a m, t h e
t h e Prime M i n i s t e r i s now s a t i s f i e d w i t h the wordingr e g a r d i n g t h e f i n a n c i a l i s s u e g i v e n i n y o u r t e l e g r a m No. I ll t o t h e C a n a d i a n G o v e r n m e n t . Ends.
CYPRiiili TELEGRAM CANADA i the United Kingdom High Cpl^mls-iesipne.r in Canada, d 27-th November., 1939. Received 4 . 5 3 a.in, on 20th Nov. 1939. MOST IMMEDIATE. No. 718. (l) I fully realise the difficulty which it must have caused the l/ar Cabinet to agree to the assurances given in your telegram No. Ill to the Canadian Government. It is therefore all the more disappointing to us all to have to record that that telegram failed in its object of enabling agreement to be initialled before Fairbairn left. (2/ But the Prime Minister is in one of his most uncompromising and at the same time changeable moods and it has been impossible to predict from moment to moment what form of wording would suit him. The wording given in paragraph 2 of my telegram Iic 717 was however s written at his dictation and in his presence by the Minister ? of Air and he cannot now"depart from it. (3) The position now is that (a) press statement is being given out rank and file (b) Fairbairn has left, and will write from New York tomorrow accepting the memorandum which had been drawn up for initialling today, (c) BalfOur is also leaving bringing copy of the memorandum with him (d) Presumably Canadian Ministers who meet in the Cabinet November 28th will go quietly ahead with study of the memorandum and finally (e) we may hope for further progress after receiving your views as to the Prime Minister's wishes regarding preference of effort (see my telegram No. 717) Riverdale will of course stay on.
id CYPHER TELEGRAM CANADA Prom the Government of Canada; Dated 27th November. Received 4 . 5 5 a , H , , 28th November, 1939 IMPORTANT No. 118 Secret. Discussions regarding Air Training Scheme have been, proceeding favourably but we were not in a position to initial the Agreement today. As suggested after consideration b y several Air Training delegations today it was, however, agreed to make trie following announcement whie will appear in tomorrow's press: "The Missions and Committees representing the Governments of the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand and Canada have completed their discussions with regard to the Joint Air Training Scheme, They have worked out ?basis of agreement which is now being referred to their respective Governments for decision". With reference to your telegram today I shall reply after consultation with colleagues tomorrow. Ends.
